title: After Dollar-Bond Default, Chinese Developer Fantasia Says It Will Fix Its Finances
sub_head: Prices of Fantasia’s yuan-denominated bonds plummeted when they resumed trading on the Shanghai Stock Exchange
body:
SINGAPORE— Fantasia Holdings Group Co. , the real-estate developer whose surprise default this week caused a selloff in U.S. dollar bonds of many Chinese property companies, said Friday that it is working with the support of local governments and others to resolve its problems.
Financial markets in mainland China reopened Friday after a weeklong public holiday. Prices of Fantasia’s yuan-denominated bonds plummeted when they resumed trading on the Shanghai Stock Exchange, causing temporary trading halts. One of its bonds with a November 2022 maturity date dropped 53 points to about 44.8 cents on the dollar, according to data provider Wind.
